abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Agricultural Credit and
            Export Promotion Project in Zimbabwe are as follows: overall
            outcome of the project was rated marginally satisfactory,
            and the performance of the Bank and the Borrower were rated
            marginally satisfactory. Some of the lessons learned from
            the project are: 1) the need to appropriately sequence
            project interventions, particularly in relation to
            implementing required policy reforms and strengthening
            institutional capacity before major expansion programs are
            implemented; and 2) the lesson learned from the pilot
            horticultural field trials relates to the importance of
            collaboration among various agencies providing agricultural
            services at the local level in strengthening
            research/extension/farmer linkages for effective technology
            dissemination, and its adoption by smallholder farmers.
